caption:
Table 1: Annotation-free segmentation (mIoU). (a) We evaluate the per-
formance of MaskCLIP(+) on two standard datasets. For Pascal Context, we 
ignore the evaluation on the background class. The target model of MaskCLIP+ 
is Deeplabv2-ResNet101. KS and PD denote key smoothing and prompt de-
noising respectively. And they are not used in MaskCLIP+. (b) We test the 
robustness of MaskCLIP on Pascal Context under various types of corruption

training. mIoU(U) denotes mIoU of the unseen classes. SPNet-C is the SPNet 
with calibration. On PASCAL Context, all methods use DeepLabv3+-ResNet101 
as the backbone segmentation model and the rest two datasets use DeepLabv2-
ResNet101. For MaskCLIP+, CLIP-ResNet-50 is used to generate pseudo labels

PASCAL VOC, PASCAL Context, and COCO Stuff, in terms of unseen mIoUs,

(on a scale of 100). Note that the overall mIoU of MaskCLIP+ is on par with that 
of fully supervised baselines. Please refer to
